p: Each week between 0% and 12% of cohort participants reported symptoms classifiable as ILI (Figure S2), with an average of 2% per week, yielding roughly one ILI per person per calendar year (any etiology). Conversely, an average of 13% of participants tested positive for a new viral infection during weeks in the cold/flu season (Figure S3), indicating between 3 and 4 infections per cold/flu season per person. Table 3 reports the average number of cases of influenza, HRV, coronavirus, HMPV, RSV, PIV, and adenovirus per person per season.
